did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Clippings from magazines and newspapers relating to Fuller; two photographs; "Universal Requirements of a Dwelling Advantage;" "Shelter: A Correlating Medium for the Forces of Architecture"; "Schedule of Seminars and Speaking Engagements;" and "The Dymaxion Airocean World Fuller Projective Transformation. Fluid Geography."

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Buckminster Fuller was a visiting lecturer in the College of Architecture at Cornell in 1952 and 1957. Under his direction, students built an experimental geodesic dome structure.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Clippings from magazines and newspapers relating to Fuller; two photographs; "Universal Requirements of a Dwelling Advantage," 1949; "Shelter: A Correlating Medium for the Forces of Architecture"; "Schedule of Seminars and Speaking Engagements," 1949-1950; and "The Dymaxion Airocean World Fuller Projective Transformation. Fluid Geography," 1955.

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: Cornell University. College of Architecture, Art, and Planning.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: R. Buckminster Fuller. Miscellany, #15-3-3327. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

did.unittitle: Collection consists of a single box. Online guide unavailable.
